The oldest newspaper in Western Canada, the Winnipeg Free Press has published since 1872 on Treaty 1 land and the National Homeland of the Red River Métis.

Our editorial mission is to strengthen society by ensuring there is a trusted, independent source of information the public can rely upon to understand the world they live in, to connect with their community and to make decisions about what matters most to their lives.

This account automatically posts headlines and links to breaking news.

Indoor air quality at my kids' school is all I care about. Used to care about usual things like data engineering in Rust or flying helicopters. Now, to avoid sick breathers we explore public lands in our Land Cruiser (100) and the city on our our bikes (4 yo included). I fix my cars (e61, e92) for exercise. I also refuse to buy the enshittified IoT appliances they sell now. MS computer science. Eugene, Oregon (having lived everywhere else).

AFK UNTIL MID-SEPT

By Cory Doctorow (GPG 0xBF3D9110957E5F4C)

The power of accurate observation is frequently called cynicism.

Working on governance, risk, and social patterns across federated systems. Previously: COVID Tracking Project + Knight Mozilla OpenNews + editorial and community in tech and culture orgs.

I want our tools and networks to be better in more ways for more people in more places.

Online 2-3 days a week. <3

note: Lawyer, Vlogger, Filmmaker Twitter @PeterStefanovi2

Documenting the disaster.

Mute, Block, or add the word or hashtag #twitter to your filters in settings to stop seeing these posts.

Feel free to keep me up to date and ping me in posts, I will boost them. Will only boost captioned posts.

(Unaffiliated) View in website form: https://twitterisgoinggreat.com/

Twitter is Going Great is a project inspired by Web3 is Going Just Great to track the latest examples of how Twitter is actively falling to pieces thanks to its current owner Elon Musk (with special guests Jack Dorsey and the Saudi Arabian royal family). Unofficial account, mirroring the RSS feed.
